concept.title: Attributes with multiple values
concept.shortdesc: You can have more than one value for a select attribute. The different values are stored in the one attribute, separated by spaces.

conbody.p: In many cases, you may want to apply more than one value to a metadata attribute. For example, a paragraph may relate to audiences of both admin and manager.

Attributes can take more than one value. Spaces are used as delimiters, to separate the different values. For example, a paragraph with two audience values would be marked up as:

The installation...
Obviously, then, individual values of metadata attributes must not contain spaces.

section.title: Rationale

lq.reftitle: Phil Grisier, Yahoo! FrameMaker DITA Users Group

section.lq:
In DITA by design, the filtering attributes @product, @audience, etc, use space as the separator between different filtering values. This lets you apply multiple filtering criteria to elements, just as you can apply multiple FrameMaker conditions to the same piece of text. For example:
product="Basic Version-1"
product="DeLuxe Version-1"
product="Basic Version-2"
product="DeLuxe Version_2"
